data.title: International Department Central Committee of CPC
data.text:
ROVANIEMI, Finland, Sept. 12 -- Luo Gan, a senior Chinese Communist Party official, ended Friday his three-day goodwill visit to Finland after inspecting the Frontier Guard of Lapland District.

Officers from the Frontier Guard briefed Luo about Finland's border control and cooperation with neighboring countries. Luo arrived here on Thursday from Helsinki after meeting Finnish government and parliament leaders.

The Finnish Frontier Guard, which is under the command of the Interior Ministry in peace time, has 3,100 troops and 65 border control stations.

On Wednesday, Luo visited the headquarters of Nokia Corporation in Helsinki. Mikko Heikkonen, Nokia's executive vice president, briefed Luo and his entourage on Nokia's history and business in China as well as the latest technology that the corporation is developing.

Nokia, which maintains the largest exporter in mobile telecommunications industry, has manufacturing bases in Beijing, Dongguan and Suzhou in China, which is now Nokia's second largest market in the world.

On Wednesday, Luo met separately with Finnish Prime Minister Matti Vanhanen and Parliament Speaker Paavo Lipponen, who is also chairman of the Finnish Social Democratic Party.

Luo arrived in Helsinki on Tuesday evening after visiting Iceland. Finland is the second leg of his four-nation tour, which will also bring him to Armenia and Moldova.

Enditem
